page.title: 13ST.MARGARET'S CHURCH HALL
page.content: St. Margaret's Church Hall was opened in 1963 by the Bishop of Lincoln. The hall was paid for with money bequeathed by the Misses May and Mildred Robinson. When built it was used for church events as the old Parish Hall was still in existence. The latter fell in to gross disrepair and was closed and sold - a house now occupying this site. Village events moved to St. Margaret's Church Hall. Its modern uses, under the management committee,are dancing,weddings,Evergreen Club, bingo. whist drives and occasional school functions and general parties. Within the hall is a chapel which is used for Sunday worship between Christmas and Easter.
